Frame.Nav: Sloping rear hood helps provide excellent visibility.
The vibratory drum comes in smooth and pad foot configurations, delivering 32,000 to 73,125 lbs. of centrifugal force. Leveling blade option is available.
The cab and ROPS canopy are well-insulated from the chassis through isolated mounting points, providing comfortable operation.
"Left and right service doors provide access to hood and platform activation switches and battery-disconnect switch.
Dual frequencies and dual amplitude combine with high centrifugal forces for maximum compaction performance.
Muffler mounted under-the-hood makes for quieter operation and directs exhaust away from the operator.
Articulated chassis provides 36-degree turning angle. Heavy-duty articulation and oscillation joint is easy to service.
Left and right flip down steps make it easier to access under-hood areas and the top of the machine.
Left and right ladder-style steps ease entry to and exit from the cab.
Heavy-duty integral rear bumper and fuel tank provide excellent balance and extra fuel capacity for up to 36 hours of operation.
Rugged frame and extra-thick sideplates enhance durability and uptime operation".
Halogen floodlights in rear and front provide excellent visibility.
Excellent traction and gradeability help Case rollers work steep grades for optimum productivity.
Operator station features ergonomic, easy-to-use controls, suspension seat that swivels left and right.
Operator platform tilts forward for convenient access to components.
Batteries, oil fill, hydraulic tank fill and filters easily accessed at ground level.
Exclusive power-raise rear hood provides quick access to the engine and daily service points.
